summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is identified as an authorizing official on payroll authorization forms for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature appears on documents related to staff payroll records, specifically those detailing the employment, salary adjustments, and position changes of HSCA employees. The documents span from 1976 to 1978, indicating his involvement during the active period of the HSCA's investigation. The payroll records themselves are subject to review and partial postponement by the Assassination Records Review Board, primarily concerning the redaction of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. Gonzalez's role appears to be administrative, authorizing the employment and compensation of staff members involved in the HSCA's work.
key_connections: HSCA staff members (e.g., James Lerer Wolf, James K. Conzelman)
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature on payroll documents indicates his involvement in the administrative aspects of the HSCA's operations, specifically in authorizing the employment and compensation of staff members who were directly involved in the investigation into the assassination of President Kennedy. While not directly involved in the investigative work, his role was essential for the functioning of the HSCA.
